pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:0.5: 9. The second training rule on exchanging what belongs to a group
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:1.2: At that time the nuns staying at the precincts belonging to a certain association were weak because of a lack of rice porridge.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:1.3: Then, after collecting voluntary contributions to supply the nuns with rice porridge, that association stored the ingredients in a shop. They then went to the nuns and said,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:1.4: “Venerables, rice porridge ingredients are stored in such-and-such a shop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:1.5: Please have someone get rice from that, have rice porridge cooked, and then eat it.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:1.6: But even though they had asked for them, the nuns exchanged those ingredients for tonics, which they then used.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:1.7: When that association found out about this, they complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:1.8: “When collective ingredients are designated for a specific purpose and were asked for, how could the nuns exchange them for something else?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:1.12: “… When collective ingredients are designated for a specific purpose and were asked for, how could the nuns exchange them for something else?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:1.13: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:1.14: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:1.15.1: ‘When a collective requisite is designated for a specific purpose and was asked for, if a nun exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.5: A requisite is designated for a specific purpose:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.6: it was given for a specific purpose.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.8: belonging to a group, not to the Sangha, not to an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.10: that she herself had asked for.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.12: if, apart from the purpose for which it was given, she exchanges it for something else, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.13: When she obtains it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.14: It is to be relinquished to the Sangha of nuns, a group, or an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.15: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.16: (To be expanded as in Nuns’ Relinquishment 1, [](pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.21--2.1.43), with appropriate substitutions.)
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.17: ‘Venerables, this thing, which I got in exchange for a collective requisite that was designated for a specific purpose and had been asked for, is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.18: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.22.1: If it is for a specific purpose and she perceives that it is, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.23: If it is for a specific purpose, but she is unsure of it, and she exchange it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.24: If it is for a specific purpose, but she does not perceive that it is, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.25: When she receives in return what had been relinquished, it is to be used in accordance with the intention of the donors.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.26: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she perceives that it is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.27: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.28: If it is not for a specific purpose, and she does not perceive that it is, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.30: if she makes use of the remainder;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.31: if she makes use of it after getting permission from the owners;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.34: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:2.35: The ninth training rule is finished.
